Plots Project Michael Sodeke 2021-01-06 1 A Basic Plot There are many ways to creeate interactive plots. One way is to use the plotly package in R. Interactive plots are essential in the field of Data Analysis. The plotly, caret, and dplyr package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("plotly") install.packages("caret") install.packages("dplyr") Now load these packages in the R terminal suppressMessages( require(plotly) ) suppressMessages( require(caret) ) suppressMessages( require(dplyr) ) In order to create an interactive plot, do the following: df <- mtcars df2 <- df %>% as.data.frame() df2$mpg <- df2$mpg - mean(df2$mpg) plt <- plot_ly(data=df2,x=~wt,y=~mpg,type='scatter',mode='markers') plt
